result.execSummary:
The defendant Anthony D Smith was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Anthony D Smith is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Anthony D Smith was found guilty of Endanger Safety/Use/Dangerous Weapon, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 941.20(1)(a).
  • Anthony D Smith was found guilty of Possession of THC, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).
  • Anthony D Smith was found guilty of Operate with Restricted Controlled Substance (1st). This is not a criminal offense and results only in a money penalty for this offense.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Defendant Anthony D Smith in court, in custody with attorney Amanda K. Riek.  Jane E. Kohlwey appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Second amended information filed.  Reading waived.  Court questioned difference in new charges.  ADA Cross explained.  Recommendations are agreed upon.  Rights/Elements.  Defendant plead no contest to Cts. 1,2, & 4 of Second amended information.  Court found guilty.  Judgment was entered.  Ct. 3 is dismissed.  Court sentenced defendant on Ct. 1 to serve 240 days jail.  $443.00 costs.  Ct. 2 89 days jail, consecutive to Ct. 1. $443.00 costs.  Ct. 4 $671.50 costs and fines.  AODA and comply.  6 month DL revocation.   60 days to pay or set up a payment plan with Clerk of Courts.  247 days jail credit.  Court considers time served.

Defendant Anthony D Smith in court, in custody with attorney Amanda K. Riek.  Troy Cross appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Information filed, reading waived. Defendant stood mute. Court entered not guilty plea, jury trial to be set. Bond continued.  Speedy trial demand filed by Atty Riek.

Defendant Anthony D Smith in court, in custody, with attorney Amanda K. Riek. Troy D Cross appeared for the State of Wisconsin, called Trooper Marquardt, sworn in. Direct by ADA Cross. Trooper identified defendant. Cross examination by Atty. Riek. Exhibit 1 presented & identified as Trooper's report. Court found probable cause, bound defendant over for further proceedings.  Information filed, reading waived.  Arraignment scheduled for February 11, 2015 at 02:45 pm.
